abstract: The TMX Group, parent of the Toronto Stock Exchange, said the offer by Canadian banks and pension funds was “inadequate” and not superior to its deal with the London Stock Exchange.
snippet: The TMX Group, parent of the Toronto Stock Exchange, said the offer by Canadian banks and pension funds was “inadequate” and not superior to its deal with the London Stock Exchange.
lead_paragraph: The TMX Group, the parent company of the Toronto Stock Exchange, said late on Friday that it had rejected a unsolicited takeover bid from a consortium of Canadian banks and pension funds, saying the offer was “inadequate” and not superior to its merger agreement with the London Stock Exchange.

headline.main: Toronto Exchange Rejects Rival Bid by Canadian Banks
